page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: Bow Brickhill is served by the Bletchley_Bedford branch railway line which takes people to Bletchley,Fenny Stratford,Woburn Sands and Bedford from the station which is within walking distance of the village.You buy your ticket on the train.Trains start running at 05.10 and run every hour but in rush an extra train is put on.The last train departs at 21.00.The cost of a return ticket to Bow Brickhill is 30p for a child,50p for an adult.Bow Brickhill is now served by a Monday to Saturday M.K.City bus service.There is no sunday public transport to the village.A few villagers willingly offer a lift in an emergency for people without their own transport .They have a regular rota drawn up.
